component:ember-leaflet/components/array.title: ArrayPathLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/array.text: A class that extends PathLayer with a @locations argument. Layers that require multiple points extend this class.

attributes.name: ArrayPathLayer
attributes.description: A class that extends PathLayer with a @locations argument. Layers that require multiple points extend this class.

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: An array of geographical points.

component:ember-leaflet/components/base-.title: BaseLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/base-.text: The base class for all ember-leaflet layer components. It contains common abstractions used on all layers, including setting event listeners, gathering init options, etc. It is meant to be subclassed with the createLayer method being mandatory to implement.

attributes.name: BaseLayer
attributes.description:
The base class for all ember-leaflet layer components. It contains common abstractions used on all layers, including setting event listeners, gathering init options, etc.

It is meant to be subclassed with the createLayer method being mandatory to implement.

arguments.name: pane
arguments.description: By default the layer will be added to the map's overlay pane. Overriding this option will cause the layer to be placed on another pane by default.

arguments.name: attribution
arguments.description: String to be shown in the attribution control, e.g. "© OpenStreetMap contributors". It describes the layer data and is often a legal obligation towards copyright holders and tile providers.

arguments.name: onAdd
arguments.description: Fired after the layer is added to a map.

arguments.name: onRemove
arguments.description: Fired after the layer is removed from a map.

arguments.name: onPopupopen
arguments.description: Fired when a popup bound to this layer is opened.

arguments.name: onPopupclose
arguments.description: Fired when a popup bound to this layer is closed.

arguments.name: onTooltipopen
arguments.description: Fired when a tooltip bound to this layer is opened.

arguments.name: onTooltipclose
arguments.description: Fired when a tooltip bound to this layer is closed.

component:ember-leaflet/components/circl.title: CircleLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/circl.text: A class for drawing circle overlays on a map. It's an approximation and starts to diverge from a real circle closer to poles (due to projection distortion).

attributes.name: CircleLayer
attributes.description: A class for drawing circle overlays on a map. It's an approximation and starts to diverge from a real circle closer to poles (due to projection distortion).

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Radius of the circle, in meters.

component:ember-leaflet/components/circl.title: CircleLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/circl.text: A circle of a fixed size with radius specified in pixels.

attributes.name: CircleLayer
attributes.description: A circle of a fixed size with radius specified in pixels.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Radius of the circle marker, in pixels. Defaults to 10.

component:ember-leaflet/components/div-o.title: DivOverlayLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/div-o.text: A base class for PopupLayer and TooltipLayer.

attributes.name: DivOverlayLayer
attributes.description: A base class for PopupLayer and TooltipLayer.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The offset of the popup position. Useful to control the anchor of the popup when opening it on some overlays. Defaults to Point(0, 7).

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: A custom CSS class name to assign to the popup.

arguments.name: pane
arguments.description: Map pane where the overlay layer will be added.

component:ember-leaflet/components/geojs.title: GeojsonLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/geojs.text: Represents a GeoJSON object or an array of GeoJSON objects. Allows you to render GeoJSON data and display it on the map.

attributes.name: GeojsonLayer
attributes.description: Represents a GeoJSON object or an array of GeoJSON objects. Allows you to render GeoJSON data and display it on the map.

arguments.name: geoJSON
arguments.description: An object in GeoJSON format to display on the map.

arguments.name: pointToLayer
arguments.description: A Function defining how GeoJSON points spawn Leaflet layers. It is internally called when data is added, passing the GeoJSON point feature and its LatLng.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: A Function defining the Path options for styling GeoJSON lines and polygons, called internally when data is added.

arguments.name: onEachFeature
arguments.description: A Function that will be called once for each created Feature, after it has been created and styled. Useful for attaching events and popups to features.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: A Function that will be used to decide whether to include a feature or not.

arguments.name: coordsToLatLng
arguments.description: A Function that will be used for converting GeoJSON coordinates to LatLngs. The default is the coordsToLatLng static method.

arguments.name: markersInheritOptions
arguments.description: Whether default Markers for Point type Features inherit from group options. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: onLayeradd
arguments.description: Fired when a layer is added to this FeatureGroup.

arguments.name: onLayerremove
arguments.description: Fired when a layer is removed from this FeatureGroup.

component:ember-leaflet/components/image.title: ImageLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/image.text: Used to load and display a single image over specific bounds of the map.

attributes.name: ImageLayer
attributes.description: Used to load and display a single image over specific bounds of the map.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the image

arguments.name: bounds
arguments.description: The geographical bounds the image is tied to.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.description: The opacity of the image overlay. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: alt
arguments.description: Text for the alt attribute of the image (useful for accessibility).

arguments.name: interactive
arguments.description: If true, the image overlay will emit mouse events when clicked or hovered. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: crossOrigin
arguments.description: Whether the crossOrigin attribute will be added to the image. If a String is provided, the image will have its crossOrigin attribute set to the String provided. This is needed if you want to access image pixel data. Refer to CORS Settings for valid String values. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: errorOverlayUrl
arguments.description: URL to the overlay image to show in place of the overlay that failed to load.

arguments.name: zIndex
arguments.description: The explicit zIndex of the overlay layer. Defaults to 1.

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: A custom class name to assign to the image. Empty by default.

arguments.name: onLoad
arguments.description: Fired when the ImageOverlay layer has loaded its image

arguments.name: onError
arguments.description: Fired when the ImageOverlay layer fails to load its image

component:ember-leaflet/components/inter.title: InteractiveLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/inter.text: Some Layers can be made interactive - when the user interacts with such a layer, mouse events like click and mouseover can be handled. Use the event handling methods to handle these events.

attributes.name: InteractiveLayer
attributes.description: Some Layers can be made interactive - when the user interacts with such a layer, mouse events like click and mouseover can be handled. Use the event handling methods to handle these events.

arguments.name: interactive
arguments.description: If false, the layer will not emit mouse events and will act as a part of the underlying map. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: bubblingMouseEvents
arguments.description: When true, a mouse event on this layer will trigger the same event on the map. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Fired when the user clicks (or taps) the layer.

arguments.name: onDblclick
arguments.description: Fired when the user double-clicks (or double-taps) the layer.

arguments.name: onMousedown
arguments.description: Fired when the user pushes the mouse button on the layer.

arguments.name: onMouseup
arguments.description: Fired when the user releases the mouse button pushed on the layer.

arguments.name: onMouseover
arguments.description: Fired when the mouse enters the layer.

arguments.name: onMouseout
arguments.description: Fired when the mouse leaves the layer.

arguments.name: onContextmenu
arguments.description: Fired when the user right-clicks on the layer, prevents default browser context menu from showing if there are listeners on this event. Also fired on mobile when the user holds a single touch for a second (also called long press).

component:ember-leaflet/components/leafl.title: LeafletMap
component:ember-leaflet/components/leafl.text: The central class of ember-leaflet — it is used to create a map on a page and manipulate it.

attributes.name: LeafletMap
attributes.description: The central class of ember-leaflet — it is used to create a map on a page and manipulate it.

arguments.name: center
arguments.description: Initial geographic center of the map

arguments.name: zoom
arguments.description: Initial map zoom level

arguments.name: minZoom
arguments.description: Minimum zoom level of the map.

arguments.name: maxZoom
arguments.description: Maximum zoom level of the map.

arguments.name: maxBounds
arguments.description: When this option is set, the map restricts the view to the given geographical bounds, ouncing the user back if the user tries to pan outside the view.

arguments.name: crs
arguments.description: The Coordinate Reference System to use. Don't change this if you're not sure what it means.

arguments.name: closePopupOnClick
arguments.description: Set it to false if you don't want popups to close when user clicks the map. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: zoomSnap
arguments.description: Forces the map's zoom level to always be a multiple of this. By default, the zoom level snaps to the nearest integer; lower values (e.g. 0.5 or 0.1) allow for greater granularity. A value of 0 means the zoom level will not be snapped. Defaults to 1.

arguments.name: zoomDelta
arguments.description: Controls how much the map's zoom level will change after a zoomIn(), zoomOut(), pressing + or - on the keyboard, or using the zoom controls. Values smaller than 1 (e.g. 0.5) allow for greater granularity. Defaults to 1.

arguments.name: trackResize
arguments.description: Whether the map automatically handles browser window resize to update itself. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: trackResize
arguments.description: Whether the map can be zoomed to a rectangular area specified by dragging the mouse while pressing the shift key. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: doubleClickZoom
arguments.description: Whether the map can be zoomed in by double clicking on it and zoomed out by double clicking while holding shift. If passed 'center', double-click zoom will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: dragging
arguments.description: Whether the map be draggable with mouse/touch or not. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: tap
arguments.description: Enables mobile hacks for supporting instant taps (fixing 200ms click delay on iOS/Android) and touch holds (fired as contextmenu events). Defaults to true.

arguments.name: tapTolerance
arguments.description: The max number of pixels a user can shift his finger during touch for it to be considered a valid tap. Defaults to 15.

arguments.name: touchZoom
arguments.description: Whether the map be draggable with mouse/touch or not. Defaults to *.

arguments.name: bounceAtZoomLimits
arguments.description: Set it to false if you don't want the map to zoom beyond min/max zoom and then bounce back when pinch-zooming. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: scrollWheelZoom
arguments.description: Whether the map can be zoomed by using the mouse wheel. If passed 'center', it will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: wheelDebounceTime
arguments.description: Limits the rate at which a wheel can fire (in milliseconds). By default user can't zoom via wheel more often than once per 40 ms. Defaults to 40.

arguments.name: wheelPxPerZoomLevel
arguments.description: How many scroll pixels mean a change of one full zoom level. Smaller values will make wheel-zooming faster (and vice versa). Defaults to 60.

arguments.name: keyboard
arguments.description: Makes the map focusable and allows users to navigate the map with keyboard arrows and +/- keys. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: keyboardPanDelta
arguments.description: Amount of pixels to pan when pressing an arrow key. Defaults to 80.

arguments.name: inertia
arguments.description: If enabled, panning of the map will have an inertia effect where the map builds momentum while dragging and continues moving in the same direction for some time. Feels especially nice on touch devices. Enabled by default unless running on old Android devices. Defaults to *.

arguments.name: inertiaDeceleration
arguments.description: The rate with which the inertial movement slows down, in pixels/second². Defaults to 3000.

arguments.name: inertiaMaxSpeed
arguments.description: Max speed of the inertial movement, in pixels/second. Defaults to Infinity.

arguments.name: easeLinearity
arguments.description: Defaults to 0.2.

arguments.name: worldCopyJump
arguments.description: With this option enabled, the map tracks when you pan to another "copy" of the world and seamlessly jumps to the original one so that all overlays like markers and vector layers are still visible. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: maxBoundsViscosity
arguments.description: If maxBounds is set, this option will control how solid the bounds are when dragging the map around. The default value of 0.0 allows the user to drag outside the bounds at normal speed, higher values will slow down map dragging outside bounds, and 1.0 makes the bounds fully solid, preventing the user from dragging outside the bounds. Defaults to 0.0.

arguments.name: attributionControl
arguments.description: Whether a attribution control is added to the map by default. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: zoomControl
arguments.description: Whether a zoom control is added to the map by default. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: zoomAnimation
arguments.description: Whether the map zoom animation is enabled. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: zoomAnimationThreshold
arguments.description: Won't animate zoom if the zoom difference exceeds this value. Defaults to 4.

arguments.name: fadeAnimation
arguments.description: Whether the tile fade animation is enabled. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: markerZoomAnimation
arguments.description: Whether markers animate their zoom with the zoom animation, if disabled they will disappear for the length of the animation. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: transform3DLimit
arguments.description: Defines the maximum size of a CSS translation transform. The default value should not be changed unless a web browser positions layers in the wrong place after doing a large panBy. Defaults to 2^23.

arguments.name: onBaselayerchange
arguments.description: Fired when the base layer is changed through the layers control.

arguments.name: onOverlayadd
arguments.description: Fired when an overlay is selected through the layers control.

arguments.name: onOverlayremove
arguments.description: Fired when an overlay is deselected through the layers control.

arguments.name: onLayeradd
arguments.description: Fired when a new layer is added to the map.

arguments.name: onLayerremove
arguments.description: Fired when some layer is removed from the map

arguments.name: onZoomlevelschange
arguments.description: Fired when the number of zoomlevels on the map is changed due to adding or removing a layer.

arguments.name: onResize
arguments.description: Fired when the map is resized.

arguments.name: onUnload
arguments.description: Fired when the map is destroyed with remove method.

arguments.name: onViewreset
arguments.description: Fired when the map needs to redraw its content (this usually happens on map zoom or load). Very useful for creating custom overlays.

arguments.name: onLoad
arguments.description: Fired when the map is initialized (when its center and zoom are set for the first time).

arguments.name: onZoomstart
arguments.description: Fired when the map zoom is about to change (e.g. before zoom animation).

arguments.name: onMovestart
arguments.description: Fired when the view of the map starts changing (e.g. user starts dragging the map).

arguments.name: onZoom
arguments.description: Fired repeatedly during any change in zoom level, including zoom and fly animations.

arguments.name: onMove
arguments.description: Fired repeatedly during any movement of the map, including pan and fly animations.

arguments.name: onZoomend
arguments.description: Fired when the map has changed, after any animations.

arguments.name: onMoveend
arguments.description: Fired when the center of the map stops changing (e.g. user stopped dragging the map).

arguments.name: onAutopanstart
arguments.description: Fired when the map starts autopanning when opening a popup.

arguments.name: onLocationerror
arguments.description: Fired when geolocation (using the locate method) failed.

arguments.name: onLocationfound
arguments.description: Fired when geolocation (using the locate method) went successfully.

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: Fired when the user clicks (or taps) the map.

arguments.name: onDblclick
arguments.description: Fired when the user double-clicks (or double-taps) the map.

arguments.name: onMousedown
arguments.description: Fired when the user pushes the mouse button on the map.

arguments.name: onMouseup
arguments.description: Fired when the user releases the mouse button on the map.

arguments.name: onMouseover
arguments.description: Fired when the mouse enters the map.

arguments.name: onMouseout
arguments.description: Fired when the mouse leaves the map.

arguments.name: onMousemove
arguments.description: Fired while the mouse moves over the map.

arguments.name: onContextmenu
arguments.description: Fired when the user pushes the right mouse button on the map, prevents default browser context menu from showing if there are listeners on this event. Also fired on mobile when the user holds a single touch for a second (also called long press).

arguments.name: onKeypress
arguments.description: Fired when the user presses a key from the keyboard that produces a character value while the map is focused.

arguments.name: onKeydown
arguments.description: Fired when the user presses a key from the keyboard while the map is focused. Unlike the keypress event, the keydown event is fired for keys that produce a character value and for keys that do not produce a character value.

arguments.name: onKeyup
arguments.description: Fired when the user releases a key from the keyboard while the map is focused.

arguments.name: onPreclick
arguments.description: Fired before mouse click on the map (sometimes useful when you want something to happen on click before any existing click handlers start running).

arguments.name: onZoomanim
arguments.description: Fired at least once per zoom animation. For continuous zoom, like pinch zooming, fired once per frame during zoom.

component:ember-leaflet/components/marke.title: MarkerLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/marke.text: Marker is used to display clickable/draggable icons on the map. Extends InteractiveLayer.

attributes.name: MarkerLayer
attributes.description: Marker is used to display clickable/draggable icons on the map. Extends InteractiveLayer.

arguments.name: lat
arguments.description: The latitude where the marker will be placed at. You can provide a @location instead of @lat and @lng.

arguments.name: lng
arguments.description: The longitude where the marker will be placed at. You can provide a @location instead of @lat and @lng.

arguments.name: location
arguments.description: A geographical point where the marker will be placed at. This is an alternative to providing @lat and @lng.

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: Icon instance to use for rendering the marker. See Icon documentation for details on how to customize the marker icon. If not specified, a common instance of L.Icon.Default is used.

arguments.name: keyboard
arguments.description: Whether the marker can be tabbed to with a keyboard and clicked by pressing enter. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Text for the browser tooltip that appear on marker hover (no tooltip by default). Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: alt
arguments.description: Text for the alt attribute of the icon image (useful for accessibility). Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: zIndexOffset
arguments.description: By default, marker images zIndex is set automatically based on its latitude. Use this option if you want to put the marker on top of all others (or below), specifying a high value like 1000 (or high negative value, respectively). Defaults to 0.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.description: The opacity of the marker. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: riseOnHover
arguments.description: If true, the marker will get on top of others when you hover the mouse over it. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: riseOffset
arguments.description: The z-index offset used for the riseOnHover feature. Defaults to 250.

arguments.name: pane
arguments.description: Map pane where the markers icon will be added. Defaults to 'markerPane'.

arguments.name: shadowPane
arguments.description: Map pane where the markers icon will be added. Defaults to 'shadowPane'.

arguments.name: bubblingMouseEvents
arguments.description: When true, a mouse event on this marker will trigger the same event on the map (unless L.DomEvent.stopPropagation is used). Defaults to false.

arguments.name: draggable
arguments.description: Whether the marker is draggable with mouse/touch or not. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: autoPan
arguments.description: Whether to pan the map when dragging this marker near its edge or not. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: autoPan
arguments.description: Distance (in pixels to the left/right and to the top/bottom) of the map edge to start panning the map. Defaults to Point(50, 50).

arguments.name: autoPanSpeed
arguments.description: Number of pixels the map should pan by. Defaults to 10.

arguments.name: onMove
arguments.description: Fired when the marker is moved via setLatLng or by dragging. Old and new coordinates are included in event arguments as oldLatLng, latlng.

arguments.name: onDragstart
arguments.description: Fired when the user starts dragging the marker.

arguments.name: onMovestart
arguments.description: Fired when the marker starts moving (because of dragging).

arguments.name: onDrag
arguments.description: Fired repeatedly while the user drags the marker.

arguments.name: onDragend
arguments.description: Fired when the user stops dragging the marker.

arguments.name: onMoveend
arguments.description: Fired when the marker stops moving (because of dragging).

component:ember-leaflet/components/path-.title: PathLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/path-.text: An abstract class that contains options and constants shared between vector overlays (Polygon, Polyline, Circle). Do not use it directly.

attributes.name: PathLayer
attributes.description: An abstract class that contains options and constants shared between vector overlays (Polygon, Polyline, Circle). Do not use it directly.

arguments.name: stroke
arguments.description: Whether to draw stroke along the path. Set it to false to disable borders on polygons or circles. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Stroke color. Defaults to '#3388ff'.

arguments.name: weight
arguments.description: Stroke width in pixels. Defaults to 3.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.description: Stroke opacity. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: lineCap
arguments.description: A string that defines shape to be used at the end of the stroke. Defaults to 'round'.

arguments.name: lineJoin
arguments.description: A string that defines shape to be used at the corners of the stroke. Defaults to 'round'.

arguments.name: dashArray
arguments.description: A string that defines the stroke dash pattern. Doesn't work on Canvas-powered layers in some old browsers.

arguments.name: dashOffset
arguments.description: A string that defines the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash. Doesn't work on Canvas-powered layers in some old browsers.

arguments.name: fill
arguments.description: Whether to fill the path with color. Set it to false to disable filling on polygons or circles.

arguments.name: fillColor
arguments.description: Fill color. Defaults to the value of the color argument.

arguments.name: fillOpacity
arguments.description: Fill opacity. Defaults to 0.2.

arguments.name: fillRule
arguments.description: A string that defines how the inside of a shape is determined.

arguments.name: bubblingMouseEvents
arguments.description: When true, a mouse event on this path will trigger the same event on the map. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: renderer
arguments.description: Use this specific instance of Renderer for this path. Takes precedence over the map's default renderer.

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: Custom class name set on an element. Only for SVG renderer.

component:ember-leaflet/components/point.title: PointPathLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/point.text: An abstract class that contains options and constants shared between point-based path layers (Circle, CircleMarker). Do not use it directly.

attributes.name: PointPathLayer
attributes.description: An abstract class that contains options and constants shared between point-based path layers (Circle, CircleMarker). Do not use it directly.

arguments.name: lat
arguments.description: The latitude where the point layer will be placed at. You can provide a @location instead of @lat and @lng.

arguments.name: lng
arguments.description: The longitude where the point layer will be placed at. You can provide a @location instead of @lat and @lng.

arguments.name: location
arguments.description: A geographical point where the point layer will be placed at. This is an alternative to providing @lat and @lng.

component:ember-leaflet/components/polyg.title: PolygonLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/polyg.text: A class for drawing polygon overlays on a map. Extends Polyline. Note that points you pass when creating a polygon shouldn't have an additional last point equal to the first one — it's better to filter out such points.

attributes.name: PolygonLayer
attributes.description: A class for drawing polygon overlays on a map. Extends Polyline. Note that points you pass when creating a polygon shouldn't have an additional last point equal to the first one — it's better to filter out such points.

component:ember-leaflet/components/polyl.title: PolylineLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/polyl.text: A class for drawing polyline overlays on a map.

attributes.name: PolylineLayer
attributes.description: A class for drawing polyline overlays on a map.

arguments.name: smoothFactor
arguments.description: How much to simplify the polyline on each zoom level. More means better performance and smoother look, and less means more accurate representation. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: noClip
arguments.description: Disable polyline clipping. Defaults to false.

component:ember-leaflet/components/popup.title: PopupLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/popup.text: Used to open popups in certain places of the map.

attributes.name: PopupLayer
attributes.description: Used to open popups in certain places of the map.

arguments.name: maxWidth
arguments.description: Max width of the popup, in pixels. Defaults to 300.

arguments.name: minWidth
arguments.description: Min width of the popup, in pixels. Defaults to 50.

arguments.name: maxHeight
arguments.description: If set, creates a scrollable container of the given height inside a popup if its content exceeds it. Defaults to null.

arguments.name: autoPan
arguments.description: Set it to false if you don't want the map to do panning animation to fit the opened popup. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: autoPanPaddingTopLeft
arguments.description: The margin between the popup and the top left corner of the map view after autopanning was performed. Defaults to null.

arguments.name: autoPanPaddingBottomRight
arguments.description: The margin between the popup and the bottom right corner of the map view after autopanning was performed. Defaults to null.

arguments.name: autoPanPadding
arguments.description: Equivalent of setting both top left and bottom right autopan padding to the same value. Defaults to Point(5, 5).

arguments.name: keepInView
arguments.description: Set it to true if you want to prevent users from panning the popup off of the screen while it is open. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: closeButton
arguments.description: Controls the presence of a close button in the popup. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: autoClose
arguments.description: Set it to false if you want to override the default behavior of the popup closing when another popup is opened. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: closeOnEscapeKey
arguments.description: Set it to false if you want to override the default behavior of the ESC key for closing of the popup. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: closeOnClick
arguments.description: Set it if you want to override the default behavior of the popup closing when user clicks on the map. Defaults to the map's closePopupOnClick option. Defaults to *.

component:ember-leaflet/components/recta.title: RectangleLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/recta.text: A class for drawing rectangle overlays on a map.

attributes.name: RectangleLayer
attributes.description: A class for drawing rectangle overlays on a map.

component:ember-leaflet/components/tile-.title: TileLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/tile-.text: Used to load and display tile layers on the map. Note that most tile servers require attribution.

attributes.name: TileLayer
attributes.description: Used to load and display tile layers on the map. Note that most tile servers require attribution.

arguments.name: minZoom
arguments.description: The minimum zoom level down to which this layer will be displayed (inclusive). Defaults to 0.

arguments.name: maxZoom
arguments.description: The maximum zoom level up to which this layer will be displayed (inclusive). Defaults to 18.

arguments.name: subdomains
arguments.description: Subdomains of the tile service. Can be passed in the form of one string (where each letter is a subdomain name) or an array of strings. Defaults to 'abc'.

arguments.name: errorTileUrl
arguments.description: URL to the tile image to show in place of the tile that failed to load. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: zoomOffset
arguments.description: The zoom number used in tile URLs will be offset with this value. Defaults to 0.

arguments.name: tms
arguments.description: If true, inverses Y axis numbering for tiles (turn this on for TMS services). Defaults to false.

arguments.name: zoomReverse
arguments.description: If set to true, the zoom number used in tile URLs will be reversed (maxZoom - zoom instead of zoom) Defaults to false.

arguments.name: detectRetina
arguments.description: If true and user is on a retina display, it will request four tiles of half the specified size and a bigger zoom level in place of one to utilize the high resolution. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: crossOrigin
arguments.description: Whether the crossOrigin attribute will be added to the tiles. If a String is provided, all tiles will have their crossOrigin attribute set to the String provided. This is needed if you want to access tile pixel data. Refer to CORS Settings for valid String values. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: tileSize
arguments.description: Width and height of tiles in the grid. Use a number if width and height are equal, or L.point(width, height) otherwise. Defaults to 256.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.description: Opacity of the tiles. Defaults to 1.0.

arguments.name: updateWhenIdle
arguments.description: Load new tiles only when panning ends. true by default on mobile browsers, in order to avoid too many requests and keep smooth navigation. false otherwise in order to display new tiles during panning, since it is easy to pan outside the keepBuffer option in desktop browsers. Defaults to (depends).

arguments.name: updateWhenZooming
arguments.description: By default, a smooth zoom animation (during a touch zoom or a flyTo()) will update grid layers every integer zoom level. Setting this option to false will update the grid layer only when the smooth animation ends. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: updateInterval
arguments.description: Tiles will not update more than once every updateInterval milliseconds when panning. Defaults to 200.

arguments.name: zIndex
arguments.description: The explicit zIndex of the tile layer. Defaults to 1.

arguments.name: maxNativeZoom
arguments.description: Maximum zoom number the tile source has available. If it is specified, the tiles on all zoom levels higher than maxNativeZoom will be loaded from maxNativeZoom level and auto-scaled. Defaults to undefined.

arguments.name: minNativeZoom
arguments.description: Minimum zoom number the tile source has available. If it is specified, the tiles on all zoom levels lower than minNativeZoom will be loaded from minNativeZoom level and auto-scaled. Defaults to undefined.

arguments.name: noWrap
arguments.description: Whether the layer is wrapped around the antimeridian. If true, the GridLayer will only be displayed once at low zoom levels. Has no effect when the map CRS doesn't wrap around. Can be used in combination with bounds to prevent requesting tiles outside the CRS limits. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: A custom class name to assign to the tile layer. Empty by default. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: keepBuffer
arguments.description: When panning the map, keep this many rows and columns of tiles before unloading them. Defaults to 2.

arguments.name: onLoading
arguments.description: Fired when the grid layer starts loading tiles.

arguments.name: onTileunload
arguments.description: Fired when a tile is removed (e.g. when a tile goes off the screen).

arguments.name: onTileloadstart
arguments.description: Fired when a tile is requested and starts loading.

arguments.name: onTileerror
arguments.description: Fired when there is an error loading a tile.

arguments.name: onTileload
arguments.description: Fired when a tile loads.

arguments.name: onLoad
arguments.description: Fired when the grid layer loaded all visible tiles.

component:ember-leaflet/components/toolt.title: TooltipLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/toolt.text: Used to display small texts on top of map layers.

attributes.name: TooltipLayer
attributes.description: Used to display small texts on top of map layers.

arguments.name: direction
arguments.description: Direction where to open the tooltip. Possible values are: right, left, top, bottom, center, auto. auto will dynamically switch between right and left according to the tooltip position on the map. Defaults to 'auto'.

arguments.name: permanent
arguments.description: Whether to open the tooltip permanently or only on mouseover. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: sticky
arguments.description: If true, the tooltip will follow the mouse instead of being fixed at the feature center. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: interactive
arguments.description: If true, the tooltip will listen to the feature events. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.description: Tooltip container opacity. Defaults to 0.9.

component:ember-leaflet/components/video.title: VideoLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/video.text: Used to load and display a video player over specific bounds of the map. A video overlay uses the  HTML5 element.

attributes.name: VideoLayer
attributes.description: Used to load and display a video player over specific bounds of the map. A video overlay uses the

arguments.name: video
arguments.description: The URL of the video (or array of URLs, or even a video element) and the geographical bounds it is tied to.

arguments.name: bounds
arguments.description: The geographical bounds the video is tied to.

arguments.name: autoplay
arguments.description: Whether the video starts playing automatically when loaded. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: loop
arguments.description: Whether the video will loop back to the beginning when played. Defaults to true.

arguments.name: keepAspectRatio
arguments.description: Whether the video will save aspect ratio after the projection. Relevant for supported browsers. See browser compatibility Defaults to true.

arguments.name: muted
arguments.description: Whether the video starts on mute when loaded. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: bubblingMouseEvents
arguments.description: When true, a mouse event on this layer will trigger the same event on the map. Defaults to true.

component:ember-leaflet/components/wms-t.title: WmsTileLayer
component:ember-leaflet/components/wms-t.text: Used to display WMS services as tile layers on the map.

attributes.name: WmsTileLayer
attributes.description: Used to display WMS services as tile layers on the map.

arguments.name: layers
arguments.description: (required) Comma-separated list of WMS layers to show. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: styles
arguments.description: Comma-separated list of WMS styles. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: WMS image format (use 'image/png' for layers with transparency). Defaults to 'image/jpeg'.

arguments.name: transparent
arguments.description: If true, the WMS service will return images with transparency. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: version
arguments.description: Version of the WMS service to use Defaults to '1.1.1'.

arguments.name: crs
arguments.description: Coordinate Reference System to use for the WMS requests, defaults to map CRS. Don't change this if you're not sure what it means. Defaults to null.

arguments.name: uppercase
arguments.description: If true, WMS request parameter keys will be uppercase. Defaults to false.

functions.name: divIcon
functions.description: Represents a lightweight icon for markers that uses a simple <div> element instead of an image. Inherits from Icon but ignores the iconUrl and shadow options. More information about its possible options here.

functions.name: icon
functions.description: Represents an icon to provide when creating a marker. More information about its possible options here.

functions.name: latLngBounds
functions.description: Represents a rectangular geographical area on a map by defining two diagonally opposite corners of the rectangle. Instead of two corners, you can also pass in an array of points, and the helper will return the rectangular area that contains all those points.

functions.name: icon
functions.description: Represents a point with x and y coordinates in pixels. More information about its possible options here.

params.name: round
params.description: if `true`, rounds the x and y values

template:addons.title: Addons
template:addons.text: Addons Why addons for an addon? There is a lot of room for customization and new functionality in ember-leaflet. However, that functionality may not be desirable to be included in every ember-leaflet project, or it may just be too specific for a certain scenario. Leaflet plugins are good candidates for ember-leaflet addons. This concept follows the lead of the great ember-power-select and ember-cli-deploy. This addon list is auto generated from npm registry. If you made an addon and want it to show up here checkout the instructions here. Warning! Many of the following addons might not be updated to latest ember-leaflet 5.x yet. Addons: -

template:docs/actions.title: Actions and interaction
template:docs/actions.text: Actions and interaction Often you will need to capture interaction on your map. Ember-leaflet sends actions based on the corresponding leaflet events (and there are a lot of them!). Ember-leaflet embraces DDAU (Data Down Actions Up) philosophy of Ember 2.0+, so data flow is always unidirectional and explicit. In other words, if you want to change the map state, just change the data you provide to ember-leaflet components. However, when a certain state is changed by a component (say, the map's center coordinates), ember-leaflet won't update your data. Instead you can use an action to update the data yourself. Maximum flexibility. Latitude: / Longitude: Here we used the action @onMoveend that triggers when the map stops to move. In this action we update our controller variables which are bound the the inputs. Notice how when you change the inputs, the map changes its state! This gives us the flexibility to do whatever we need when the user interacts with the map. Currently, all actions get the leaflet raw event passed in.

template:docs/adding-layers.title: Adding layers
template:docs/adding-layers.text: Adding layers A map is only interesting with layers to represent some information. The most obvious layer you will probably want is the tile layer. In fact it is so obvious that we tend to forget it is a layer like any other. Ember-leaflet provides the <layers.tile> component that enables you to create tile layers. This is raster data, so you'll need a tile layer server that provides them for you. Here are some free tile layer servers you can use. Let's use some cool tiles from CartoDB and see how it looks. Neat. We have tiles, can move the map around and have the default leaflet controls. Not bad for three lines of code. Let's now try to add some markers in it. The Oregon Convention Center 777 NE Martin Luther King Jr Blvd Portland, OR 97232 Hotel So, there are two important things to notice here: We now used a different notation to represent the coordinates. Instead of using lat and lng we used a [lat, lng]. You can use these two notations interchangeably. Did you notice how we used <marker.popup> inside <layers.marker>'s block to specify our popup text? Go ahead and click the markers. It feels Ember and it feels natural. Why not a form in a popup? A component? Why not {{outlet}}? Possibilities are endless.

template:docs/addons.title: Addons
template:docs/addons.text: Addons Leaflet has many plugins and they provide very useful features for your maps. To use them in ember-leaflet, the community created ember addons that extend ember-leaflet functionality, usually using some of those Leaflet plugins under the hood. A list of those addons can be found in the addons page. Using an addon As an example, let's take ember-leaflet-marker-cluster addon. You can install it by running: ember install ember-leaflet-marker-cluster This addon will register a new <layers.marker-cluster> component and you can use it like in the following example: Creating an addon Showing up on ember-leaflet addons page The ember-leaflet addons page automatically fetches npm packages that meet these criteria: the package name must start with ember-leaflet- it must contain the ember-leaflet keyword on the package.json file the link to the repository should be correctly filled in on the package.json file Integration with <LeafletMap> component It is very common for addons to add new kinds of layers, like we've just seen with ember-leaflet-marker-cluster. In order for <LeafletMap> component to yield your custom component you need to register it on the included ember-leaflet service in an instance initializer. Here is an example of the instance initializer that ember-leaflet-marker-cluster uses to register its marker-cluster component: // addon/instance-initializers/register-component.js export function initialize(appInstance) { // first we lookup the ember leaflet service let emberLeafletService = appInstance.lookup('service:ember-leaflet'); // to support older versions of ember-leaflet that do not include the service, we add a guard here if (emberLeafletService) { // we then invoke the `registerComponent` method emberLeafletService.registerComponent('marker-cluster-layer', { as: 'marker-cluster' }); } } export default { initialize }; The registerComponent method accepts two arguments: the component name an options object. Only the as option is supported at the moment. The as option is the name under which the component will yielded as from the <LeafletMap> component. Yielding additional components from new components It is usual for new components to yield additional components in addons. In the example above, there is a new <layers.cluster> component that yields a <cluster.marker> component. If you're extending from BaseLayer (or another layer that extends from it), there is a special property you can use called componentsToYield. This should be an array of objects that describes which components you want to yield. You should use it like: // addon/components/market-cluster-layer.js componentsToYield = [ ...this.componentsToYield, { name: 'marker-layer', as: 'marker' } ]; name is the name of the component itself as is the key that you want to put it under in the yielded hash (the key will default to the name value if an empty as is provided) BaseLayer's template will make sure to yield these components correctly for you. Including the leaflet plugin Your addon should be responsible for including the necessary leaflet plugin, either using ember-auto-import or importing it by customizing your index.js file. Please user other ember-leaflet addons as a reference.

template:docs/container.title: The container
template:docs/container.text: The container Think of your map as a set of layers inside a container. Your main container will be the component <LeafletMap>. This component creates the map container where your tiles, vectors and markers will be added to. Let's see how it looks: This example looks "broken", but that is intended. Please keep reading. Notice that we specified the center of the map and its zoom level passing regular properties to the component, bound to the controller. You can check what arguments each component supports in the "Components" section of the docs. Here @lat, @lng and @zoom are arguments that the component <LeafletMap> supports. Reminder: The leaflet map container needs to be styled to have some size. If you don't see any container at all, that's probably because you forgot to style it. You can target leaflet containers in css using the .leaflet-container class or providing an id or class attribute in your <LeafletMap> component. Ok, we have a leaflet default container, but it's empty. That won't get us anywhere, but this is expected since we never specified any child layers, right? Let's see how to do it.

template:docs/index.title: Overview
template:docs/index.text: Overview Web apps frequently need to display geographic data, especially if it has a direct relationship with the real world. That isn't new, and has been done previously in all kinds of formats, particularly with raster and vector data. Ember apps naturally may have the same requirements and until now, devs have been either using mapping libraries outside of ember scope, or using previous versions of ember-leaflet. The problem was that both approaches were hard. Frequently existing libraries have regular javascript imperative APIs and html in mind. We all know and love how ember makes us flow the data in our app. Previous approaches simply didn't fit where ember really shines: templates, actions, routing, and above all, expressiveness. Ember-leaflet allows you to express your maps right in your templates. Also, it is streamlined for ember in general. You have things like actions, components and the ability to use regular handlebars helpers like {{#if or {{#each. We can't go wrong with delegating the mapping part to the battle tested, performant and lightweight Leaflet library. So, let the mapping begin.

template:docs/installation.title: Installation
template:docs/installation.text: Installation Ember-leaflet is packaged as an Ember-cli addon. As usual, the only thing you need to do is to run an install command in your ember app directory: ember install ember-leaflet This command installed all ember-leaflet components and leaflet itself, along with its styles and assets. You're ready to map! Note: For production builds, update ember-cli's fingerprinting exclusions for the assets included in ember-leaflet. See here for more details. // ember-cli-build.js let app = new EmberApp(defaults, { // Add options here fingerprint: { exclude: [ 'images/layers-2x.png', 'images/layers.png', 'images/marker-icon-2x.png', 'images/marker-icon.png', 'images/marker-shadow.png' ] } });

template:docs/templates.title: They're just templates!
template:docs/templates.text: They're just templates! That's right. You still get to use all of your template powers. We can render layers, just like we can render anything else. Let's check out some ways to use {{#if}} and {{#each}}. Night mode Rating: /5 DANGER ZONE Portland Restaurants Lat: Lng: Popup open? Try to drag the markers, edit restaurant names and switch "Night mode". Confirm that the data flows normally. All of this is done through normal Ember usage. Ok, I was going to explain, but I think you can figure this yourself. After all, this is just regular handlebars and Ember. Loops, conditionals, actions, bindings, computed properties, components. "You'll feel at home", that's what was promised. Delivered.

template:index.title: Powerful and easy
template:index.text: Powerful and easy With Leaflet as its foundation you get its simplicity, performance and usability. All of this right in your application's templates! Declarative Your templates end up with a concise, readable and maintainable code that pretty much explains itself. {{#marker-layer}} Popup text! {{/marker-layer}} Built for Ember Components are streamlined for ember usage. Use {{#if, {{#each, component blocks, actions or even Ember router. You'll feel at home! Map tiles by CartoDB, under CC BY 3.0. Data by OpenStreetMap, under ODbL. "Sustainable Energy" icon by Jens Windolf and "text" icon by Austin Andrews from the Noun Project
